title: FS: 1912 Detroit Tigers Opening Day Postcard With Ty Cobb Same Week As Titanic SOLD
author: Moonlight Graham

posts.post_title: FS: 1912 Detroit Tigers Opening Day Postcard With Ty Cobb Same Week As Titanic SOLD
posts.post_content:
Really great postcard and highest graded example-Ty Cobb is 2nd from far right. The price is SOLD delivered PayPal friends/family. Thank you for having a look!!

Joe K.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=596213&d=1699380280[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=596214&d=1699380292[/IMG]
Bump-reasonable offers? I paid way more than my asking but I guess I screwed up on this one. :)

Hi, I'm curious why they are unfurling a huge banner that celebrates being Champions in 1912?  They were champs (of the AL) in 1907, 08, and 09.  Wouldn't this most likely be a postcard from 1908, 09, or 1910?  Furthermore, they opened the 1912 season in Cleveland.

Just wondering.  It's a great card.
Mark they have this exact photo in the Detroit Public Library and they have it listed as 1912 as well.

found this old thread with some great detective work on this issue
